required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adaptation of Lipid and Energy Metabolism During a Lipid Overnutrition in Constitutional Thinness
clinical_study.official_title: Adaptation of Lipid and Energy Metabolism During a Lipid Overnutrition in Constitutional Thinness

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock: For a given food intake, fat and energy metabolism in adipose tissue and muscle adapt to nutrient intakes. This adaptation to nutrition may be impaired in susceptible individuals or in obese patients by promoting weight gain, either in constitutional thinness (MC) by blocking it. The MC is a little known entity. These patients wish to grow for her and others. Can they? We have demonstrated abnormalities of hormones regulating appetite (ghrelin, PYY, GLP1 and leptin) that may participate in thinness. Furthermore, this thinness is associated with osteoporosis in 25% of true MC who is 25 years old.

detailed_description.textblock: This project aims to overfed MCs and follow the control parameters of energy metabolism. We will look for abnormalities in the adaptation to overnutrition in subjects with genetic background of thinness, which could explain the resistance to weight gain. The answer could possibly help to understand obesity.

primary_outcome.time_frame: After one month of lipid overnutrition
primary_outcome.description: Level of genes (which regulate the lipid and energy metabolism) expression in fat and muscle tissues

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After one month of lipid overnutrition
After one month of lipid overnutrition
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate variability analyses using ECG Holter monitoring

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After one month of lipid overnutrition
After one month of lipid overnutrition
After one month of lipid overnutrition
After one month of lipid overnutrition
After one month of lipid overnutrition

arm_group.description: Women with a a body mass index of less than 16.5 kg/m2
Women with a body mass index between 20 and 25 kg/m2

intervention.description: During 4 months, the daily caloric intake will be increased by about 70 g fat as butter 20 grams, 100 grams of cheese (Emmental) and 40 grams of almonds. This overnutrition corresponds to an excess of 760 kcal / day or 21,280 calories for the period and then taken to a theoretical 2.4 kg of fat (1 kg fat = 9000 kcal).

study_pop.textblock: Constitutionnal thinness women and healthy volonteers(women)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- consent form the study signed
- consent form for genetic study signed
- normal laboratory values for liver enzymes, glucose, lipid
Exclusion Criteria (common to the two groups):
- pregnant
- vegetarian
- heavy smoking
- heavy alcohol
- depressive
- taking hypolipidemic or antihypertensive drugs
- dyslipidemia
